IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Alcohol Influence : On 02/05/2023 at approximately 1532 hrs, M/T Lechliter and I were dispatched by the Cumberland Barrack to respond to Rt 36 and Iron Rail Street, Mt Savage, for a report of a motor vehicle collision. While en route to the collision the barrack advised they had obtained information that the collision was serious in nature and there were multiple injuries. Upon my arrival I observed 2 vehicles in the roadway, both with severe front end damage. One vehicle was a Ford Taurus and the other a Kia Forte. Due to numerous injuries, 5 between the two vehicles, there were numerous emergency responders on the scene treating all victims. M/T Lechliter, who arrived prior to myself, was able to briefly speak with the operator of one of the vehicles, the Ford Taurus, Mikayla Filer, who advised M/T Lechliter that the other vehicle had came into her lane and struck her vehicle head on. It was discovered that the Ford Taurus was also occupied by 2 children that were in the rear seat of the vehicle. All occupants in that vehicles were being treated for injuries and were all taken by ambulance to UPMC Western Maryland. I attempted to get as much information as possible from the 2nd vehicle, Kia Forte, however the operator of that vehicle appeared to have serious injuries and was being attended to by several medics. I was not able to get close to the operator at that time. It was discovered that the vehicle was also occupied by a child that was in the rear seat, who also appeared to have a serious injury and was being treated by medics. I was able to identify the operator as Dylan Tanner Roy, W/M, DOB 08/18/1997 and the child as his son, Jase. Due to the above facts I was not able to talk to or even get close to occupants. ( See ACRS report for additional information regarding the collision ) After the above I was told that both the driver and passenger in the Kia Forte were being transported up the road to a landing zone, that both were being flown out by MSP Medevac helicopters Trooper 5 and Trooper 3, and both were being taken to Ruby Memorial Hospital in Morgantown, WV. After the above and due to the serious injuries in the collision, a re-constructionist from MSP was requested. Cpl. D. Diehl responded for the reconstruction. At some point during the investigation, I was advised that the operator of the Kia Forte, Dylan Tanner Roy, who was determined to also be the at fault, advised one of the medics on the scene that he had been drinking. At the time I could not verify that. Due to the above facts, a subpoena is being prepared to send to Ruby Memorial Hospital requesting medical records for Mr. Dylan Roy. On Feburary 6, 2023 the barrack obtained information from Maryland Child Protective Services. The information obtained was the agency had been contacted by Ruby Memorial Hospital in regard to a child neglect complainant as result of this collision.The complaint stated that Dylan Tanner Roy had a blood alcohol content of .15, therefore the complainant stemmed from him transporting his son, who was the rear seat passenger, in that condition. Due to the above facts I am requesting this case remain open, pending service and results of the subpoena being sent to Ruby. Once that information is obtained, the States Attorney will be consulted as to what charges to pursue.

Detailed Crash Investigation Report Section I. - Introduction: On February 5, 2023 at approximately 1532 hours, there was a motor vehicle collision on Mt Savage Road (MD Route 36) north of Iron Rail Street, Mt. Savage, Allegany County, Maryland 21545. The collision was between a silver 2016 Kia Forte and a white 2012 Ford Taurus. The Kia was traveling north on Mt. Savage Road north of Iron Rail Street. The Ford was traveling South at the same location. The passenger side of the Kia struck a concrete retaining wall along the edge of the roadway. The front right portion of the Kia then struck the corner of a stone retaining wall along the side of the roadway. The impact with the stone wall caused the Kia to travel into the southbound lane directly in front of the Ford. The front of the Kia struck the front of the Ford. The impact caused the Kia to travel back into the northbound lane where it came to final rest. The Ford came to final rest in the southbound lane. The driver and passenger of the Kia were Flown to Ruby Memorial Hospital in Morgantown, West Virginia. The driver and both passengers of the Ford were transported by ambulance to UPMC Western Maryland Hospital in Cumberland, Maryland. Section II. - Scene Description: (The following descriptions are based on the area where the collision occurred.) Primary Roadway: The roadway was constructed of asphalt. There was one northbound lane and one southbound lane. There were no shoulders along the roadway at this location. There was a guardrail along the southbound lane and a concrete wall along the northbound lane. There were no intersecting roads or traffic controls in this area. The speed limit on Mt Savage Road at this location was 30 mph. The roadway was clear, dry, and free from debris at the time of this collision. The road contained no defects. Environmental Conditions: The weather at the time of the collision was clear. The temperature was approximately 52 degrees Fahrenheit. It was daylight at the time of this collision. Section III. - Scene Evidence: There was a tire track through some small rocks along the right edge of the northbound lane. The track was visible for 14 feet. At the end of the tire track there were scrapes visible on a concrete wall. The scrapes on the wall continued for 18 feet. At the end of the wall there was a driveway. No evidence marks were available at this location. On the north side of the driveway, there was a stone wall. The stone wall started 29 feet from the initial scrapes on the concrete wall. There was significant damage to the corner of the stone wall from the impact of the Kia Forte. There were skid marks from the stone wall to the point of impact with the Ford Taurus in the southbound lane. The skid marks were 65 feet long traveling from the right shoulder of the northbound lane, across the center line of the road, and into the southbound lane. There rear bumper of the Kia Forte came to final rest 18 feet 7 inches from the point of impact. There was debris scattered throughout the collision scene. Some debris had been moved or removed by the fire department and EMS when they arrived at the scene to treat the involved parties. Section IV. - Vehicle(s) Involved: Vehicle #1: Silver 2016 Kia Forte Maryland Registration 6CA6029 VIN: KNAFX4A81G5479993 Owner: Ashley Dawn Roy font-size:14px"> The Kia Forte sustained significant crush damage to the front and engine compartment. Both front fenders, the passenger side A pillar, and front Passenger door also sustained crush damage. The windshield was broken but remained in place. The drivers seatbelt was against the B pillar and did not show signs of usage. Buckleys Towing was contacted to remove the vehicle from the scene. The vehicle was towed to and stored at the Barrack lot. Vehicle #2: White 2012 Ford Taurus Maryland Registration 7FE6759 VIN: 1FAHP2EW7CG112304 Owner: Mikayla Gayle Filer The Ford sustained significant crush damage to the front and engine compartment. Both front fenders and front doors also sustained crush damage. The drivers side A pillar sustained damage. The left side of the windshield was broken but remained in place. Kiffs Towing was contacted to remove the vehicle from the scene. The vehicle was towed to and stored at the tow lot. Section V. - Person(s) Involved: Person #1: (Driver of vehicle 1) Dylan Tanner Roy 08/18/1997 Maryland License: R000159785645 12802 Cliffside Drive NW, Mt Savage, Maryland 21545 Dylan Roy was flown from the scene prior to any interaction with law enforcement. Dylan Roy was not secured by a seat belt during this collision. No statement was given. Person #2: (Passenger of vehicle 1) Jase Steven Roy 03/14/2017 Maryland License: N/A 12802 Cliffside Drive NW, Mt Savage, Maryland 21545 Jase Roy was flown from the scene prior to any interaction with law enforcement. Jase Roy was seated in a booster seat and secured by a seat beltNo statement was given. Person #3: (Driver of vehicle 2) Mikayla Gayle Filer 03/21/1994 Maryland License: F460603271229 12902 Saint Georges Lane NW, Mt Savage, Maryland 21545 Mikayla Filer was transported to the hospital by ambulance prior to law enforcement arrival. No statement was given. Person #4: (Passenger of vehicle 2) Rose Filer 10/01/2016 Maryland License: N/A 11914 Colorado Avenue, Cumberland, Maryland Mikayla Filer was transported to the hospital by ambulance prior to law enforcement arrival. No statement was given. Person #5: (Passenger of vehicle 2) Lauren Robertson 05/13/2021 Maryland License: N/A 12902 Saint Georges Lane NW, Mt Savage, Maryland 21545 Mikayla Filer was transported to the hospital by ambulance prior to law enforcement arrival. No statement was given. Section VI. - Follow-up Investigation: Appropriate charges will be completed by MTpr King once medical records are obtained from WVU Ruby Memorial Hospital. Section VII. - Analysis of Electronic Control Modules: None Section VIII. - Speed Analysis: None Section IX. - Crash Dynamics: Asilver 2016 Kia Forte was traveling north on Mt. Savage Road north of Iron Rail Street. There were no traffic controls on Mt. Savage Road at this location. A white 2012 Ford Taurus was traveling South at the same location. The Kia traveled across the white line along the edge of the northbound lane. The passenger side of the Kia struck the concrete wall along the edge of the roadway. The front right portion of the Kia then struck the corner of a stone wall along the side of the roadway. The impact with the stone wall caused the Kia to travel into the southbound lane directly in front of the Ford. The front of the Kia struck the front of the Ford. The impact caused the Kia to travel back into the northbound lane where it came to final rest. The Ford came to final rest in the southbound lane Section X. - Attachments that were included in for this report: The following items were attached to this report: 1. Diagram 2. ACRS 3. MSP Form 62 - Photograph Record 4. MVA Printouts 5. Vehicle Storage Reports for both vehicles involved 6. 34 Digital Photographs (Located in Veripic) Conclusion: On February 5, 2023 at approximately 1532 hours, there was a motor vehicle collision on Mt Savage Road (MD Route 36) north of Iron Rail Street, Mt. Savage, Allegany County, Maryland 21545. The Maryland State Police Cumberland Barrack requested that I respond to the scene. This was a two vehicle collision between a silver 2016 Kia Forte and a white 2012 Ford Taurus. The Kia was traveling north on Mt. Savage Road north of Iron Rail Street. The Ford was traveling South at the same location. The passenger side of the Kia struck the concrete wall along the edge of the roadway. The front right portion of the Kia then struck the corner of a stone wall along the side of the roadway. The impact with the stone wall caused the Kia to travel into the southbound lane directly in front of the Ford. The front of the Kia struck the front of the Ford. The impact caused the Kia to travel back into the northbound lane where it came to final rest. The Ford came to final rest in the southbound lane. The driver, Dylan Roy, and passenger, Jase Roy, of the Kia were Flown to Ruby Memorial Hospital in Morgantown, West Virginia. Dylan Roy was not wearing his seat belt at the time of this collision. Jase Roy was wearing a seat belt and using a child booster seat. The driver, Mikayla Filer, and both passengers, Rose Filer and Lauren Robertson, of the Ford were transported by ambulance to UPMC Western Maryland Hospital in Cumberland, Maryland. Mikayla and Rose Filer were wearing seat belts. Lauren Robertson was using a forward facing child safety seat. All parties involved were treated at either UPMC Western Maryland Hospital or WVU Ruby Memorial Hospital for non-life-threatening injuries. There were no witnesses to this collision. This case can be reassigned to MTpr King for additional DUI investigation and completion of charges. See MTpr. Kings narrative in reference to the DUI investigation of the at fault driver. Corporal Dwight Diehl #5745 Cumberland Barrack 1125 National Highway Cumberland, MD 21502 301-729-2101

Since the last supplement was filed, I have been informed that Mr. Dylan Roy has been released from the hospital in Morgantown, WV and is now home in Mt Savage, MD. Due to those facts, I contacted and was able to speak with State Attorney, Ms, L. Thomas and was able to discuss the case with her. Ms Thomas advised I could attempt to contact Mr. Roy and issue him traffic citations for all related charges, which we also discussed. Ms Thomas also advised she would Subpoena all the blood records from the hospital in Morgantown, WV. On 03/20/2023 at 1030 hrs, I responded to 12802 Cliffside Dr, Mount Savage, MD and was able to contact Mr. Dylan Roy. Mr Roy was issued traffic citations at that time. Mr Roy advised he had no memory of what exactly occurred the day of the crash. Citations issued : 1) Citation # 4CF0B30, 21-901.2 (b), Negligent Driving 2) Citation # 4CG0B30, 21-901.1(a), Reckless Driving 3) Citation # 4CH0B30, 21-902(a1i), Driving vehicle while under the Influence of Alcohol 4) Citation # 4CJ0B30, 21-902(a1ii), Driving Vehicle while under the influence of Alcohol per se 5) Citation # 4CK0B30, 21-902 (b1I), Driving Vehicle while Impaired by Alcohol. 6) Citation # 4CL0B30, 21-902 ( b2i), Driving Vehicle while Impaired by Alcohol while Transporting a minor. Due to the above facts I am requesting this case be closed.
